node.statement: EPI-TO-STAM REDUCTION: In classical information theory, EPI implies Stam via: (1) Define I_t = N(p boxplus G_t), (2) By de Bruijn, dI_t/dt = (2/m)*N*Phi_n, (3) EPI gives N(p boxplus q boxplus G_t) >= N(p boxplus G_{t/2}) + N(q boxplus G_{t/2}) for appropriate scaling, (4) Differentiate at t=0 to get the Stam inequality. Adapt this derivation to the finite free setting using de Bruijn (node 1.4.1) and Gaussian splitting (node 1.4.4). The key is verifying that the differentiation and limit operations are valid for polynomial entropy.
